subject: p18338007
History: Mental status changes, presenting from nursing home. Please evaluate for pneumonia.
Findings: AP and lateral chest radiographs demonstrate stable bilateral low lung volumes with persistent elevation of the left hemidiaphragm with air distended bowel beneath. Mediastinal contours are stable. The cardiac contour is not well evaluated due to elevation of the diaphragm. Compared to prior study, there is increased pulmonary vascular congestion. No focal opacification concerning for pneumonia identified. No pleural effusion or pneumothorax evident.
Impression: Low lung volumes. No focal opacification concerning for pneumonia. Mild prominence of the pulmonary vasculature may indicate mild volume overload.
